resources.string: Maximal period of connection loss before notifying the server
Please enter the number of motes that you want to place in the house:
We are now going to walk through beacon placement.\n\nPlease go to the room with the tallest ceiling and enter its height (in feet):
Please go to the patient\'s bedroom and place the first beacon on the ceiling, in the center of the room.
Please go to the next room you want to monitor and place a beacon on the ceiling, in the center of the room.
Keep in mind the beacon\'s number.
The house setup is now complete!\n\nWe will now train the beacons to recognize what it looks like when the patient is in the room.
Please go next to each beacon and click on the appropriate \'Scan\' button.
Mark allowed transitions for each room.
Failed to connect to the watch.\nPlease make sure that the watch is on and try again.

Please walk around '%s' for about two minutes.
Try to do as if you were using the room as usual.

Data acquisition…
\'%s\' data collected!\n\nNow click on \'Done\' and follow the instructions.
The configuration is now done. The patient\'s profile will be sent to the server.
Click on the appropriate button to indicate your current state. The acquisition will not stop unless you specify to do so or you return to the previous screen.
Select the fields you want to display.\n\'patient\' and \'timestamp\' fields can be filtered.
Please wait, data are uploaded from the watch to the phone…
The patient\'s profile is now completed.\n\nPlease wait until the configuration file is successfully sent to the server…
The connection to the server failed.\n\nPlease make sure that the Internet connection is enabled and try again.
The patient\'s profile was successfully sent to the server.\n\nData are now analyzed, please wait until the server finishes.
The server is not responding.\n\nPlease make sure that the Internet connection is enabled and try again.
The watch is not responding.\nPlease make sure that the watch is on and try again.
The patient\'s profile has been successfully sent to the server.\n\nYou can now continue and start data acquisition.
Please wait, data are uploaded from the phone to the server…
Failed to push data to the server.\n\nPlease make sure that the Internet connection is enabled and try again.

Something went wrong during data analysis:
"%s"

Please make sure that all the information you entered are valid.
Room data are now going to be validated.\nPlease wait…
The room beacon seems to not function properly…\nPlease try again or change of beacon.
You can find the beacon id written on the back of the beacon.
Please enter the ceiling height in feet.
What floor are you on?\nIf the home has only one floor, pick \'1st Floor\'.
Please enter an unique name to identify the current room.
We measure the position of new beacons in terms of old beacons (in feet).\nYou can choose any direction instead of North and East as long as you keep them for the whole process.
The room \'%1$s\' is now linked to mote \'%2$s\'.
Data successfully pushed to the remote server.
Connecting to the watch. Please wait…
The watch is now connected, please proceed.
Watch connection failed. Make sure that the watch is on and retry.
Please wait until patient\s profile is sent to the server.
Please wait until the server finishes to analyse the patient\'s profile.
Bluetooth is required for beacon monitoring!
No beacon in range! Please make sure that at least one beacon is in range.
Please enter a valid patient ID.
Please enter a valid patient username.
Please enter a valid number of motes.
Please enter a valid height distance.
Please click on the \'Scan\' button near to a mote to associate it with the appropriate room.
Please enter the name of each rooms and make sure to assign them to a mote.
This action cannot be done - some settings are not properly setup.
Some rooms have not been checked.
The table \'%s\' cannot be found in the DataManager.
Do you really want to remove this entry from the table \'%s\'?
Please make sure that you filled properly all the fields.
Please wait until gps location is acquired.
Starting a new acquisition will delete previously acquired data. Do you really want to continue?
